t0JlEDd8yoxAeRaphMnhOQ.text: Do NOT order a bowl of anything here...the bowl is very tiny and costs $5.  The manager even said that the size of the bowl is just a cup.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. This is a bowl here.  Avoid the soup or chili...bad size, too small.

1--1o98Vd0xcMA4Nar9Z_g.text: Picked here to eat due to it was right around the corner from my friends condo and it had outdoor seating (the weather was too nice to sit inside). Our server was was friendly and great. Started of with drinks, which that had a nice selection of beers and cocktails. After our first round we order appetizers and dinner, which both were very tasty. Was tempted by desert (our server did a good job to try to entice us, but we were all full from dinner). If you want to watch any sporting event, this would be a good place to do so. They have a crazy number of TVs.

yWdzcljFsawaZuNbZqh2Zg.text: So I've been here a handful of times and it seems to me like something is just missing. They've got a great selection of tastey adult libations...aka drinks! Preyy good servers for a sports bar kinda atmosphere. But it seems they just miss the mark with the food. I've gotten wings, a burger and a wrap the couple of times I was there and they were just ehhh....I had to send my wings back and so did the other 3 people at the table who had them because they were super chewy and the sauce tasted funny. Either way, my frinds and I like this place to watch sports and we were glad to see it open back up after the old business (Jillians) closed since its in a great spot in Southend Charlotte. All in all we'll go back, but we always eat before we go now. -SK

Tl0l1hxTMpuVaGM9A9jNKA.text: I haven't eaten here but the drinks were flowing good and the service was great! The cocktail waitress was on point, and even considerate about the belligerently drunk guy as she started to cut him off slowly. They caused an issue for someone at the bar about losing the credit card for a short amount of time, but gave them a free shot for the trouble... The little things like that will keep me coming back to a place!

Jyn208lVdmciugZ_Kkj00w.text: cool location, good food, great potential.  I went on their first day open, 6/5/12, and it was well put together but not everything was completely finished i.e. beer taps which I understand the soft opening idea.  I had the "fiery drunk burger" which adds fried jalapenos and beer cheese to a typical burger.  It was delicious and  possibly the best cooked burger I've had in Charlotte--a perfect medium.  The fries were also very good, a thick fry batter and topped with ground pepper.  decently priced at $9 and $3 for a bottle of domestic beer.  It did look like they had some good craft beers lined up for tap so I look forward to trying those next time.  Forgot to mention, the bar has an 80" TV in the middle above it with three 60" on each side.  looks great!

rVBjdjrmu9cDxVkVTTUPQg.text: Had an hour off for lunch and this place is walking distance from my office. We were seated quickly then waited about twenty minites to get water. After ordering and waiting 40 minutes for a burger and a sandwhich had to leave to get back to work. Never got our food. Terrible service couldn't tell you what the food was like. Never goimg back there for lunch.  Now I get to wait till I get off from work to actually eat something. HORRIBLE EXPERIENCE!

6v2sWXnOwrSVXorPm2hEfw.text: This place is great to watch any type of sporting event. Bartenders are very attentive - food and drinks come quickly.  The food is not something I will look forward to again, but I go for the drinks, stay for the service and while I'm there, I eat the food. Two star deduction for OK food.

_i_geeYh99uSNR6w4uLnbQ.text: Great wings, nachos, and beer specials. Just be prepared for the huge crowd on game days. Definitely will be returning!

DrA73N5H190Pblm24aelww.text: Nah, man. You're going to have to step up your game to compete in South End. They... had beer. And.... we drank some of it. The decor was nothing special, the service was prompt, but nothing special. My friend's pepper jack sticks were alright. My sweet potato fries were good, but they came with tiny pre-packaged honey butter- how much effort does it take to whip some up yourself and serve enough for the whole portion? With all the other bars within walking distance, I can't think of a reason to come back.

7mrnSW2xqx5PNfHfYK3Jnw.text: Food is average, not bad but not great either. The bigger problem is the service, not sure if they are understaffed or what but there was a constant and long wait for everything, waiting to get seated, waiting for my first drink to come, waiting for the check... then the computer is down. Bottom line, there are better bars and pubs in area, I would keep looking.

LP7jXbMqMK-dmDkgkEHozw.text: This place has the perfect location, but I would only go back for drinks, if that. The food was the definition of average. I ordered the Mediterranean chicken salad, which sounded delicious, but it was average at best. The chicken had no flavor, the goat cheese was sporadic, and the peppers were lightly cooked. The "homemade" dressing didn't taste homemade either. The flavors didn't blend, and it made for a very bland salad. The only good thing I can say about it was that it wasn't overpriced. Reminded me of cafeteria food.

__02w2DqQL_WFmV8LdPPxw.text: Always have plenty of bartenders, so nice to not have to fight to put a drink order in. Game day menu has vegetarian options unlike some other places & it's not bad food at all.

P5Oohxq8OoMMVwivI0cYww.text: The struggle is real at this place. Not packed, but the service is definitely driving the struggle bus. Prepare to set aside a good amount of time at this joint.

dFQ4Nvya-a_JeO_kSl4Vgg.text: I went to AAP last week for lunch because I was too late for Greek Isles, but I am so glad I did!  I eat a late lunch so there was not too many people there and the hostess let me pick my table, so I took a big comfy booth.    My server came by right away and got my drink order and to see if I had any questions about the menu.  I was intrigued by the soft pretzel with beer cheese and she told me how good it was, but also how large.  So I decided to order it and if I was still hungry I'd get something else because she told me the kitchen was pretty quick.  Turns out it was a really great pretzel, the cheese wasn't my fave but the pretzel was so soft with a nice crunchy exterior and served piping hot!  I was a little hungry still so I got the spinach salad and it was also delicious.  It was spinach with tomato, cranberries and feta.  I did think it could use maybe a nut or something for a different texture, but overall a great salad.  It seems like they have drink specials during the week.  The whole place is huge and I bet it would be a great place to watch a game.  The only reason I went with 4 stars was they should have some more lunch offerings besides the salads/sandwiches, entrees don't start till after 5.  Otherwise, it was great and I will be back!

cSDXHYFyKKgXZQ6o8Nv-vQ.text: I have been here a few times and have always left satisfied. All American has very solid bar food. I would definitely recommend that you stop by during their happy hour because they have 1/2 off starters. The last time i went we showed up about 10 minutes before the special ends and our waitress told us about it so we could quickly order a round of Fried Pickles for 1/2 off. I love fried pickles and i've been very happy that you can get them almost anywhere here. They were great fried pickles, not too greasy, and the ranch was deliciously smooth. Last time i had been in one of my friends got the Buffalo Chicken Sandwich and i had been craving one since. I got this with a side of fries. I had just been to a yoga class so i decided to skip the bun. I'm happy i did because the bun they gave me was completely overwhelmingly large.The Buffalo Chicken was great. The house buffalo sauce that they coat it in is exactly what i wanted. It has enough spice to make it interesting but doesn't overwhelm. The fries here are fantastic. I swear they are either battered or double fried because they are perfectly crispy. I would recommend All American for anyone looking for a place to watch their favorite game or looking for a solid easy meal.

GNXt3CQ4r2Pu2ASqSvMxbw.text: Great for a drink and laughs but he food was so so. Service was good and very friendly!!

5uGyJrD1_B-InqbHgbHYag.text: All themerica pube has Go seminoles! FSU bare! Go for FSU game best football team! I ate that chicken nachos and yhey were real good but don't remember the rest! maybe because too much dancing! Even when FSU losen it's OK fun! Go all the america pub yes!

t-65X_fgWZtcjrvQ663nGQ.text: Good selection of tap beers.. Nice place to get a few drinks in South End before taking the light rail Uptown

-_JxEUsXAvKb5n-_WgTsUA.text: Terrible customer service. Our waiter seemed annoyed with my table although we were being very polite. I was double charged so I called once and came in person twice to get it corrected and was never contacted again. I won't be returning.

PrvcVE8JHWxxpeYcQSeFTg.text: Terrible service and a pitcher of bud light was $15...WAY over priced.  When we ordered food we also ordered another pitcher of beer (NOT realizing they were $15) and our food not only came out before our beer, we were almost done eating by the time the pitcher of beer got to our table. This is the second time we've been here and both times the service is just awful. We WON'T be back!

rejh2NDhl2PefagFYfRvgw.text: We love the wings... Try the Thai chili, so good! It's a good place to watch sports but I personally wouldn't recommend it for panthers games. Maybe I'm old but they have a DJ during the commercials and a bathroom attendant for 1pm games. It's like a day time club. - but it was perfect for March madness or some Saturday college football.

Ur40dcG5w9nXHSR1_X9caQ.text: Came here on Sunday for a late brunch. The food was delicious. The Bloody Mary bar was great. However, the service was terrible. The place wasn't even that busy. It was like all the servers were either too hungover to function at 3pm or still drunk from the St Pattys bar crawl the day before. I don't understand how it can take half an hour to rim a glass and put vodka in it ( I mixed the Bloody Mary myself at the Bloody Mary bar).   I ordered a mimosa and watched my friends finish their entire round before a server came by for me to re-order it.   I know this isn't a fine dining establishment so I don't expect all the plates to be cleared right away or crumbs swept off the table. But if the table is covered with empty glasses or plates and there is no room to put anything down, I think its getting out of hand.  The music: It was like a middle school dance minus the dance. Creed, time of your life by green day, nickelback. You know, definitely Sunday funday music- not meant for slitting your wrists in the shower.   Lastly, why would anyone think it's acceptable to accost our group over someone else's lost pack of cigarettes and accuse us of stealing them?  Edit: sorry it wasn't all bad- there was one bartender that was awesome. Thanks!

yRbnwwjBi0XD3DEIvunupw.text: Probably one of the worst experiences I've ever had in a restaurant... Waited over 1 hour and 30 minutes for food... Never came out... Caused us to miss a show we had planned to attend, and on top of all that, the manager on duty was an idiot who didn't seem to care. Will never be back. Don't plan on coming here if you want to eat.

jtnY9yPa6YS7ZrdNBLdz6g.text: This is one of the better places to watch a sporting event around town.  They have a good sized beer menu, a full bar, and decent food.  It's a sports bar - nothing more or less.  Beer is a bit expensive overall though.  The club is a good easy choice.  I tend to get the egg and bacon sandwich most of all.  The easy part is parking - they have a lot next door and they are also right on the light rail station.

L57DM75vS1D2x5skfQTHsw.text: Asked for a hockey game to be put on in this sports bar (during trivia) and the server said "we're not a hockey bar sorry, we can't put that on" ... Won't be getting my business anytime soon. And last time the Caesar salad was less than mediocre.

q62tJaT8XUI5NCtB3zM36g.text: I actually had no intention of visiting this place at all but after being so disgusted next door at Hot Taco we decided to drift over. When we got there we explained that we had been very frustrated so we just wanted quick service.  The staff were all over it! A manager even came over to apologize to us for our other experience. When we asked for the check the Manager (wish I remembered his name) had removed our first round of drinks and appetizer!! Now that is service! Hot Taco...never again! All American Pub?...Absolutely!

3TSHzjNl6olPY1BxMp3Yig.text: If I could give negative 5 stars I would. Waited well over an hour for our food. Asked for the manager and he came out twice to two different tables next to us before finally getting to ours. Then when he finally got there he just tried to blame it on being understaffed and got an attitude with us. He should be fired and never work in the industry again.

rZVWdMBfvoCVhkYFv_KDMw.text: Only giving it 1 star because the food was decent. We were sat on a Friday afternoon and waited at least 15 minutes for a server to greet us. We watched our server greet another table next to us (that had arrived 10 minutes after us) I finally went to the hostess to inform them that we had yet to have someone even stop by our table. The bartender then came over to get our order. The manager stopped by to half ass apologize. During our meal both of our glasses were empty for 85% of the meal (we only had our original drinks provides by the bartender). We got our bill -- the full amount as no comps were added. As someone who has worked in the service industry for years. It was quite possibly the worst service I've ever received. It wasn't busy and their lack of remorse was the most unsettling part. There was no desire to keep a customer, and therefore they lost one.

OcIiDyFySmICeaaoaT2HkQ.text: Ate here last week on Monday ordered my wings like I normally do, not until I got my check did I notice my wings were at regular price.  Waitress didn't say anything about the change until I was Angry.. That's just wrong.. Food cost change Everyday... Bring back the special in which gave you your space in the restaurant world ..

NEl-SC1T_eZu0SB7_BI4fw.text: Bryson is the friendliest bartender I have ever had- hands down. I have been in the service industry for over 15 years and am now a part of a management team for a popular and busy restaurant in Charlotte. I know that sometimes, servers and bartenders can be lacking in their late-night focus and it is one of my biggest peeves. You are there to work- so do your job correctly until closing. Customer service should be a priority- open to close. I usually do not get off work until 1 AM during the weekdays and I stop by AAP occasionally for a drink after a rough night and it is so refreshing to be able to have a drink without a bartender being pissy because they are doing their sidework since they are closing shortly after and they are ready to go (which seems to be the norm). Bryson greeted me with a big smile as soon as I sat down shortly after 1:15 AM- 30 minutes before last call and as she was starting her closing sidework. She was very engaging and was just as friendly to me as if I was her first customer instead of being one of her last. I greatly appreciate the welcoming attitude versus the perturbed vibe I get from some of the other bartenders when it is so close to closing, but not last call yet. Thank you so much Bryson! And to the management- hang onto her and treat her well- you have a great one!

AVhLSqr-GUkHXsUOA8PQBw.text: The service was slow. I ordered water to drink and it tasted like tap water. The wings here are small and bland. No flavor. But the atmosphere of the place is good. What I look for at restaurants are the food and service. Slow and bland. Tavern on the tracks next door have better wings.

IxaJON3FuNCnN7qSxPy-4w.text: Mimosas on point. Not a fan of the outragious spicy buffalo chicken sandwich. I would try it again and get a different food item. Everyone else in my party appeared to enjoy their chicken wings though.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Mimosa was on POINT and strong.

TDHFNQ5nhTYWKij4w-G1nw.text: Every time I walk in the door I think damn this is a place I would love to own. Then when I get my food I think God I don't own it because I'd be as big as a house!  One of my favorite places to come to chill watch a game, re-connect with friends, enjoy a cool urban outdoor area and enjoy some good food.

BFmht339YQjbyN6bxEDK1w.text: Pretty standard sports bar.  Plenty of TVs, even outside, though a number of them must have had bad connections because they were constantly garbled.   Food was ok. Had the pepper crusted tuna.  Tuna was tasty and the broccoli al dente  but the white rice it was served with was over cooked and mushy. My GFs burger and fries were just fine.  Service was slow, empty beer glasses waiting to be filled.  Don't sit out on the patio if you're sensitive to cigarette or cigar smoke.  That is generally where the smokers come out when drinking.

NUi5GY-FMgXz-I8QErlMoA.text: Loved it!! This is a great place to catch the game, hear good music, get good food, good drinks, good service.. I could go on and on.. they also have a late night menu if come in after 11pm!! Drink specials.. great place to hang out with friends or date night!! Will definitely be back!! The menu has sooo many great options to choose from!! I had the mushroom sandwich on brioche bun with feta cheese and roasted red peppers and spinach, drizzed with balsamic!! Delish!! The tater tots were crunchy and tasty as well! They have a good philly as well! Several different types of wings if that's what you like when watching games ! All in all, no complaints here!!

lHnPEEl7wTzM3jb86OOF7w.text: Tried to give this place another chance...  Once again we are disappointed!!  We got a bucket of bud light which was there special..  And our beer was warm!!!  We asked them about it and the manager said they left all the bud light in the truck and they thought it was refrigerated but it wasn't..  Should you check that before you leave them in there!!  So they told us there patio was dog friendly but then we brought out dog and they said apparently on Sundays it is not dog friendly. I asked why they did not have a sign and they said "Oh we sometimes put it out!" like really..  If you are going to choose days to not be dog friendly don't be dog friendly at all!!  Just keeps disappointing!!

RrFptkU6xzJ4vgfAfFrdew.text: I really like All American Pub for lunch time. Staff greets and treats you well.  Very attentive, with a smile.  Managers stop by and say "Hey.". Food fresh and flavorful. Wide array of seating.  Comfortable. . Thugs-beware, CMPD finest always around.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. CMPD finest frequent at lunch time....  We appreciate you guys &amp; gals.

jgL0mStZ7uy7oKzMBBH7DA.text: The food here is great but, the service is horrible..I find that certain staff is rude as hell!!! No customer service skills at all. I'm in a service industry so I definitely know how customers should be treated. 12/5/15..ACC championship night. I didn't dine in here I just came over to get a takeout. I had already called several times. It would have been of someone answered and said sorry we are so busy we won't be doing takeout orders and call ins. Instead I had to walk over and be told rudely they were at capacity and the bar was too full to take my to go order. Now I'm a football fan as well and I also hosted huge events as well before too, I know it can be stressful but organization and better planning would be better to serve the public nicely. Won't be back for a while, bad taste in my mouth. I'm also from Seattle so I'm used to city life and good service. Charlotte you and your establishments have a lot to learn when it comes to the service industry.

3iRV7G_SlKbglpxVTYLPwg.text: Restaurant has poor service and is not clean!  When we were seated the table was not clean.  The server half way cleaned off the table.  I asked for napkins to finish cleaning it off.

kjWY5S3bi8smUutRHVpfYg.text: The manager in this restaurant is rude and non-responsive to guests. On Saturday, I went there with a party of 14 and one person did not have a seat. We saw some tables with empty seats and asked them if we could use a chair. They said no. We asked the server to help us and she said that the restaurant only had one broken chair left. She told us to leave and go next door. We then spoke to the manager who was not at all empathetic. He would not help us get us a seat from one of the several tables with empty seats (even though those seats were only holding a purse or serving as footrests for some of the patrons) nor would he offer a discount to the one person in our 14 member group that had to stand. He was also rude about it as well. We took our business elsewhere.

Uktu4-fb_NvJCTQjhE0iLA.text: Its been a weeknsince Ive been.  From what I remember it was pretty good.   I had the Cheesesteak Egroll appetizer (FANTASTIC).....And the Chicken Kabobs.  The Chicken Kabobs were just OK....I probably wouldnt order them again...but they werent awful.  The chicken was cooked just enough not to get salmonella.    Our server was pretty cool and kept up with our table nicely.  I really like the design of the inside.   Handsome little spot.     Prices were not crippling expensive.  All in all....i would def go back....and order bar food .... cause Im sure thats their specialty and  not healthy food...

UY44nVzwE04m_XW184GTTQ.text: First time in and it was pretty good.  Buff chicken wrap was very good but the temp cooled down with the sauce but not a deal breaker. Great prices.

MloTKM9yB22VeBlNTpemyg.text: If you're going here to watch football on game day, you can't beat the atmosphere here...but the food is absolutely terrible. My food was cold, and i'm pretty sure the nachos had EZ squirt cheese on them. This place should not be allowed to serve food.

q9dPrd7tJ5_yzNXMEF6b8Q.text: I had a really good experience eating here.   They have a lot of specials throughout the week. Many coworkers got the fish special. I ordered a chicken sandwich. Overall the food was solid. They give you a lot of fries and they are so good- not too crispy but not limp either. The menu can pretty much please with different tastes and I struggled to choose what I wanted. Price points were reasonable, as well.   Service was hospital and quick. We were never looking around for our server. With a group of 8 there were 0 complaints. We will definitely be returning.

v3rh7BGZ99IXg9NeZ0ikBw.text: Terrible service. Just awful. Clueless hostess who offered no customer service and acted as if we were an inconvenience to her.   They gave our first table to someone else. The second table, they claimed someone in our party of 5 (we were all standing together the whole time, mind you, so this wasn't possible) said we didn't want an outside table (that never happened), and our third table, that was supposed to be outside, the manager gave us an inside table for 4 (we had 5) and said "it's not ideal but it should do".   Overall, we should've left after the first incident, but now we know. Shame on us for staying.   We left after we finally got a table. The server was just as blase and slow...

9eXSmBiZH9g6KlY6T6SRpg.text: We went to this place thinking it looked pretty cool. There were plenty of TVs,  would be nice place to watch sports here.  the appetizers absolutely sucked. Ordered Cowboy Caviar nachos and pretzels. The caviar were dry beans the nachos hardly had anything on them . will not return for eating

uCKEOXJpdPqfG3VyFj-Qug.text: I know, I know, I know... I just wrote about this place last week. But after yesterday's experience, I must share with the Yelp-verse.  Our server at our go-to Sunday football spot was out of town this weekend. So, we decided to switch things up and try AAP. Some of the group adamantly did not want a venue change. They were outvoted.  The place was PACKED. Inside and out. I didn't realize Bengals fans congregate here. It was rocking after their big win against the Patriots.   We had about ten people in our group (a group made up of current and former service industry peeps). Every single one of us was just completely blown away by the service. It seemed as though AAP had 400 people working. An empty glass wouldn't last on a table more than five minutes before someone was by to snag it. At one point, I was dropping things on the floor just to see how quickly they would be picked up. (Okay, I made the last line up, but you get my point) Our server Stacy was completely on point. Never skipped a beat the entire seven hours we were there. No one was ever drink-less. Food came out quickly.  Bravo AAP. You guys are a well-oiled machine on game day. Now if only I could say the same thing about the Panthers....

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Nachos

OOWbXWkbxNWiSTkBiWlV6g.text: Great place to go for Game Day! It gets pretty crowded though so you have to get there early. They have a great atmosphere and the food is also really good. Slightly disappointed that they recently cut down their menu to just bar food but I've never been disappointed with the food. There's usually pretty good drink deals, $5 tallboys on game day and they have a portable bar right by the door in case you don't get a table. Our service was pretty good for how crowded they were. We didn't have to wait long for our drinks or food. Overall it's a great place in Southend!

yIq7AAnNL8IVBWGD5MaV2g.text: Great experience on the patio with the bartender, Abby. She went above and beyond to get my drinks from the inside bar, and never left my glass of beer empty! Can't wait for football season, and to come hang out inside, too!

d80JZsfW6RUD-qBOk1SItA.text: Normally I have a pretty good experience here. Today's experience was fantastic because of Mary! She was extremely attentive and made sure that all of our needs were met. I enjoyed the atmosphere and the specials were great too. If you come to All American make sure you ask for Mary!

SkeaXlPFj_1E46l6hQlnVA.text: So this review could be biased based on the proximity of this place to my house - basically it's my version of MacLarens on HIMYM - I can walk to, enjoy myself, and walk/stumble back.  All things considered, its a great bar/pub for SouthEnd.   Tons of TVs, great service, and great space - indoors and out.  Food is probably not their strong-suit, but its nice to have the options while drinking since a lot of the places (craft breweries) are opting to go without a kitchen and you end up ordering food in from outside or going the food truck route.  Since I don't have cable at home, I like to go watch sporting events here.  It was absolutely crazy last night when the NC State Wolfpack won a buzzer beater with LSU to stay in the tournament.  I'm sure this place will do well during the tournament and all major sporting events.  Haven't gone here for a football Sunday, but definitely excited to check them out once football comes back.  Check their website for weekday specials.  I think they have appetizer specials for happy hour from 4-6.

YZH2Fbj6HFD5NlGd8oTN0A.text: Interesting and nice location but not a place I will be going once again. Very inexperienced wait staff. Came back after 30 minutes and after the main order is ready to tell me the side is not available. Apparently they ran out at lunch but they never bothered to share that at time of Order.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

hb-ISAKQ5EAkTlajZZ9dzA.text: Omg I'm literally here now lol The chicken and waffles was amazing! My tongue was doing fireworks. It tastes so yummy! The chicken was so crispy and the waffles were soft and fluffy! Just amazing! I will be back! Thanks AAP! One more thing , make sure you know what the Bloody Mary is before you order it! Lol

lTHHO8NaJzNVLjMiKzbByA.text: I disliked my experience here very much. I came at 11:30 AM and the place was nearly empty. After getting our drinks, the waitresses ignored us for 15 minutes as we tried to get their attention. Once we finally ordered, my order arrived incorrect, and after having it corrected, I was left with a cheeseburger that I can say tasted worse than the one I had at McDonald's later today. What redeems this place was the delicious French fries.

x23zdBx5zchWGWmfz2IPYg.text: Came here for dinner for the first time and unfortunately I won't be back. I ordered a chicken dish and sent it back as I knew it tasted funny. I ended up only eating the two sides that it came with, which also tasted kinda funny. The manager let me return the dish for another free of charge so I ordered a salad to go. Once the waitress brought my check I was actually charged for the salad. I didn't feel like going through the hassle of getting the salad taken off as my stomach started to turn into knots. So I paid for my order.  Unfortunately Forty-five minutes later I was running for the bathroom as I was food poisoned.  I called the restaurant to inform the manager that I had spent the past hour in the bathroom and he refunded me the money for salad that I was no longer going to eat. I appreciated this but I felt that my entire meal should have been refunded as I spent that entire night in agony as I was running to the bathroom and my stomach was in knots.  I have no complaints with the service on the other hand, our waitress was great. Due to this unfortunate experience I won't be back.

0quZ2cEQH5Z33BlertyeKw.text: If I had to sum up my experience at All American Pub in 16 words, they would undoubtedly be "Usually, more times than not, this place gets your order wrong and the food is okay."  All American Pub should only be used as a place to go watch a game, have happy hour with coworkers, an after kickball drink, or getting intoxicated doing all of the above, but don't ever go there when you're hungry. I am convinced that All American Pub's business plan is focused around perpetual Bud Light draft specials so that patrons become inebriated and don't realize that their order is wrong and, if they do, they are too "carefree" to say anything about it.  Now, let's talk about the service, or lack thereof. Customer service at a lemonade stand is better than this place where the wait staff's overall skill level is comparable to the performance of the Carolina Panthers this past season; but, having that personnel might be a part of the business plan as well. I have visited All American Pub several times, and my order has always been wrong..from wrong sides, wrong cheese on burger, forgotten dipping sauce (big no- no) and the latest issue, drum roll please...a simple wedge salad. Ordered a wedge salad with bleu cheese crumbles separate and Caesar dressing. What came to the table was bleu cheese crumbles on the lettuce wedge with bleu cheese dressing. Who orders bleu on bleu? This is Charlotte, NC not Roquefort, France. The blue-on-blue incident was the final straw. I will only visit All American Pub for the occasions mentioned above. That being said, don't go unless you want a headache from the order accuracy, the pathetic wait staff, or from the cheap beer.

bNxI1m5ayr0ydUcj0fonag.text: Nice bar with pretty good food. May be the loudest bar I've ever been to. Not because it's crowded. I expect a crowd on game day. The stereo or game playing on the speakers is so loud that you have to shout to talk to the person next to you.

xlUVBr8ePjZlaIfr73MP5Q.text: Tried this place out for the first time and was disappointed to say the least. The loaded fries were just fries dumped on a plate with soupy cheese on top with about 10 little slices of scallions. We had the veggie wrap which was bland and the rice wasn't cooked all the way. The waitstaff was friendly and timely so that was a plus. The food was terrible so we won't be back.

W0ySFB1ApLdi1pAofcxCHQ.text: Have you seen their wing prices? What a joke. They are just gouging people. They actually used to have decent prices but I think it's turned more about profit than a good place to come hang out with friends with reasonably priced drinks and food.  Update/Response: Morgan, I appreciate the response and the Post article for context. I, however, struggle to believe this is the sole reason for the staggering price increase, considering the price increases seen across all Bottle Cap Group restaurants in Charlotte all around the same timeframe. Not to mention, the product now being provided at this establishment is half the size and double price of the wings at surrounding restaurants.   Understand the business need but, it's unfortunate to see the impact on your loyal customers.

tKxNKKkAyAZQ_CQJbL7fMw.text: DO NOT GO TO THIS BAR!!! They serve all their meat raw, the servers don't know what they're doing and are rude, and the bouncers are meatheads that get off on being mean. live right around the corner and wish there was nothing here rather than this crap bar/restaurant

9_USlC_bLFiDm1IoFFzH_A.text: If I could give them 0 stars I honestly would. They are always out of beer that you want so you have to choose the garbage beer you have to settle for. And the food is like a terrible bar food you can expect at any bar that's a dive bar.

N1JxXGIHMx2jnBCSTLrJbw.text: The salmon salad was great. Wednesday is half priced wine night. Enjoyed my dinner a lot! Thanks Kayleigh

eR95rGuiXOIokxzZzeQDHQ.text: Been here a couple of times. Actually had lunch here today with some friends.   I like the interior. Definitely has an all american bar vibe to it. Big booths, very spacious, lots of tvs. We actually sat at the bar today.  Service is pretty good. The bartender was very friendly and the servers are usually very friendly and attentive.   Now onto the food. I ordered the philly cheesesteak, one of my friends the BLT with egg and the other friend the fish sandwich. We also shared the chicken nachos. Overall the food wasn't bad. It wasn't great, but it wasn't bad. The portions were pretty huge, I have to say. My last few visits I've ordered and liked the wings. I think I'll revert back to that habit.   The had a nice list for drinks and had daily drink specials which is always a plus. Prices were pretty reasonable too. Some of the entrees were only a couple bucks more than the sandwiches. I hear that on weekends they move the tables aside and turn it into a dancefloor. lol  Overall I won't gush over the food. It's not bad, yet not outstanding. but if you're looking for a fun place in southend to catch a game, this place is cool for that. Decent bar food choices, even better drink specials, reasonable prices, and pretty good service too.

i2unrCKhz9SiCWv8lX6ccw.text: Long work day, no car and lack of groceries called for a hearty dinner near home. Looking for a cheaper meal, I turned towards AAP since I live within a block of it. I've never been there, but I have to say that place is PACKED every night of the week. No matter what time, you can usually count on two things: some Top 40 song blaring from their patio and a cornhole tournament. I have to admit, I was a little curious what all the hype was about.  I called ahead for a chicken Mediterranean sandwich with sweet potato fries to-go. I arrived upon my 20 minute ETC and took a seat at the bar. The bartenders were busy pouring drinks while another dealt with some tab argument from a, politely put, intoxicated man. It took them a little while to acknowledge me, but I get it. They're slammed. On a Tuesday. I paid within 10-15 minutes and received warm well wishes from the staff.  The sandwich was good. 3.5 stars. Put it on better bread and I'll bump it up to 4. Creamy feta cheese, roasted red peppers and a nice balsamic glaze. The fries, on the hand... you swung and missed. 1 star. Maybe it was because they were sitting on a pickle for a while, but they were downright mushy. Really disappointing.  I can see why people like to drink there. It appears very college-y, sports bar-esque but not too loud... at least not on a Tuesday. I wouldn't mind coming back on a chill weekday night, but I don't think I could hack it on their weekends.  And ladies, from a brief scan of their front bar, the place is a meat market.

EVwWtXm1rHhSyM5bZAotPw.text: This review is directed to kitchen and food. Please do not waste your money on a lunch or dinner here. Thee kitchen will serve you expired food.

sz-Wgb6kae767_7mcq8j4A.text: Wanted to try Food Truck Friday but it was raining on my side of town so we decided to hit up  bar for food and drinks. My friend recommend American Pub . I haven't really explored this area I generally stay on South Blvd but it seems like there are a lot of nice restaurants a few streets over. Parking was pretty easy for a Friday night there is a lot past the train tracks and to the left with a parking attendant. He just asked us where we were going  and then let us in ... I'm not really sure how they regulate parking but it was FREE.99 so who cares.   Overall nice spacious pub/bar/place to watch sports. They have a general bar area, booths and high tables. There is also a patio outside but we chose to sit in a booth. I wasn't super hungry just more so came out to socialize so I ordered the large soft pretzel and a cider beer. The food and beer were pretty good but the service was a bit slow for the amount of people in there. Maybe they kick it up a notch when it's more people or a game day ?   We did notice that a different type of crowd (club like) started to come in as we were leaving around 10pm or so.

WzhDRBnhTdVwTG6EHfEt7g.text: I have to say I was super stoked to try this place, I have always heard good things, the location is awesome, I love the south end area, but this visit left me desiring more to say in the least. So we get there and the hostess completely ignored us then was very rude.  Her only comment to us after we approached, "you wanna table or something?" I was literally stunned took me probably 10 seconds to respond because I was so shocked and wanted to make sure I had not misheard.  But anyway so we wait a few minutes as it was a packed house then were seated then about 7 minutes later(I timed it) a waitress approached to see if we'd been helped, no? OK so she disappeared and a few minutes later our actual waitress shows up.  We expected it would be busy so we tried to look at the menu online ahead of time to expedite the process found some things we liked and pretty much could have ordered when we were seated, BUT not today apparently game day menu chops the menu in half and excludes all dinner entrees so nothing that we had in mind was available to order...F! I get it, they are just trying to simplify everything to streamline and improve service.... as you can read, not working for them.  And seriously took the buffalo shrimp off the apps section on game day? I feel like that would be a popular game day choice and quick to make... but anyway ordered the fiery drunk, and roasted veggies as a side.  Burger was really good, could a used a little more heat, but not complaining.  Veggies were very well prepped.  Wife enjoyed her burger but the Mac and cheese sucked, I've had better boxed Mac and cheese. Beer selection is at least decent, respectable prices, good specials.  All in all food was good and priced pretty well for what it is and how much you get.  It was very loud but I don't mind plus it was a FSU viewing party so understandably a little louder than probably normal.  Cool setup really liked the place and I WANT to love this place, but good lord that is the worst service I have had in quite a while.  I'll be back to give them another shot, hopefully they have full menu and better service next time.

wBcl4KW2Ncq2TL0FNhL8qA.text: This had to be the worst experience that I've had in a very long time, maybe ever. All the Management could say about the experience was "It is what it is." They don't have the time to properly train the kitchen staff due to the Sales volume. Really? Wish i would have known this and I wouldn't have wasted my money. One star too many.

DZNO3qRHoVVVNdKLrK1GuQ.text: Good bar scene, mostly appealed to the sports bar type. Lots of screens - good guy bar.  Lousy food. Save your calories and go somewhere else after for food. Ive tried mostly appetizers from the nachos, bbq sliders, sweet potato fries... all below avg.

PeO52P1ZfVRfkeJlNUJnqg.text: Only real question I have is who's decision was it to change the french fries up? Pretty blown about the change.. Do the right thing, bring the old fries back.

h8HaF6yPl0-DOToWpeYj5w.text: Im slightly biased because I am a Florida State fan. I love going here on game days! They have great food, decently priced drinks, and a great atmosphere. They have a bunch of tvs so no matter where you are standing or sitting you can see the game.

jRfNsTDCK-SPjNxTauPMRw.text: Good place to watch the game.  TV's are perfectly placed to view all games being played!!

9qN5cmONxtd6LUK6eIWAVg.text: All American Pub is the slightly less sexy sister of The Oak Room.   But who doesn't like an "All American" girl? Who cares if she's sexy, because she's fun and low key.   We went to the All American Pub because the Oak Room doesn't open until 10 and we needed to kill some time. I am so glad we came here first, because I got to dance a little bit, and enjoy some drink specials. They have really cheap mimosas, as well as a selection of cider, 2 things that make for a great night out.   The waitress was very nice, and although we didn't eat any of the food it looked really good. Some other people at the table got a pretzel with cheese (yum!) and a cheeseburger with fries. When we go back I will defintely be trying out that pretzel for myself.

MsPkvinJTT78N8mqQYFugA.text: I went to All American Pub to catch a football game this past weekend because it wasn't on national TV.  First off, it looked like they removed all of the bar stools and forced everyone to stand, and it is impossible to get a table. Therefore, I spent 3.5 hours standing in front of a bar getting elbowed by drunken idiots who clearly should have been cut off.  (If a guest approaches the bar, slams his drink down out of control-- he clearly does not need to be served a round of shots).  Second-- I consider myself a decent tipper and tip after every drink I order.  I had paid with cash all afternoon and tipped each time.  The last round I ordered, I only had two fives to pay for my $5 order.  I asked the bartender to break the second five so I had change.  She said, "Sure" and then proceeded to ring out my order, make change for the 5 and put ALL OF IT in her tip jar.  I was previously a bartender and I would NEVER do that.  You should never expect all change to be tip-- change should go to the customer and they can determine your tip.  I then noticed that every time that same bartender took money from someone and it was less than a dollar that was owed to the customer, she banked all of it without offering the change to the customer.  If you ask me, that is theft.    I will never recommend anyone go to All American Pub on a Sunday-- unless you want to be stolen from and bombarded by a bunch of over served drunks.

uhYr2pLAKly-V1mc6SWJ3A.text: I came here with friends because we had coupons for a free pitcher of beer that this place was obviously giving out to draw in new customers. I can confidently say that it achieved the opposite in our case. The unspecified coupon, for one, turned out to only give us either Bud Light or Budweiser, and they were out of one, so we only had the one choice. Okay, it was free, but still somewhat disappointing to people who really don't like Bud Light. My personal opinion is - if you're a new place and want to convince customers to come back, don't be skimpy and draw people in with what seems like a generous offer and turns out to be the least tasty option on the beer menu.   The food took very long to come out despite an empty restaurant, and it was very unremarkable. That also goes for the place in general - everything is shiny new and pretty nice, but the only way this place can be at all interesting is if you come with very good and entertaining company that will provide fun no matter where. We came to watch a soccer game during the Euro Cup, but it was so empty and the place so overly big that it was impossible to experience a good, exciting atmosphere during the game.

Knwio3RdDWvEjUtVeoi0Og.text: I had really high hopes for this place and came away slighlty disappointed.  The food is good, but slighlty ovepriced, and nothing really jumps out at you here.  Their management and staff have always been extremely friendly, though.

OVEA6QKI9LnLO3Vs0N2O0w.text: Food wise - I have only tried the fried pepper jack strips but they are delicious - they have a nice kick that regular mozzarella obviously do not! Everything we saw looked amazing. If we had not already been to taste of Charlotte this is where we would have been eating lunch! They even had a watermelon stack of some sort that had decent sized pieces of watermelon with feta cheese and other items in the middle that a woman next to us ordered. Looked fabulous! It is new - took over the building where Jillians was in South End. The bartender, Austin, was attentive and incredibly nice and fun! Could not have asked for a better bartender. The ambiance is great with lots of TVs to watch games and races.  The bar is literally right next to a light rail stop, so for the nights you cant drive - you can hit up the light rail. Win win. Music also is much better than other places, not just Katy Perry music (although I do love Katy Perry), including the Killers and Cake. Definitely come check it out! Will probably be a great place to go for Panthers tailgating! You also can't pass up the $2 mimosa and $4 Bloody Mary specials on Sunday. Yum!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

ETQRsocuCxFywXoFXFnd8g.text: My go to place to eat. (Living in a stones throw distance helps ;) )  I always get the same thing every time and its delicious. A soft pretzel (to share) and a fiery drunk burger (made with beer cheese and fried jalapenos). I usually get extra jalapenos   One can only try it to know the True meaning of a "mouth-gasm"  AAP....you're A ok in my book

GqC5aU2qMn0nkY5SfZzSeQ.text: Worst bar tenders in Charlotte. Inefficient, rude, and mess up a simple orders. I ordered 3 beers and ended up with 3 shots of Fireball. I told her I ordered 3 Two Hearted Ales, she left and I never got my beers even after a bar back told her I was still waiting for my order.

iirwtrZ0Wvk1t8llJ6GQ4A.text: Tried this place for lunch for the first time with a coworker today.  We typically go next door to the Greek restaurant but wanted to try something new.  It was just ok...  I definitely liked the inside decor...looks like a great place to catch a game for sure.  A lot of tv's and they are all placed in good spots.  I ordered the buffalo chicken wrap with fries.  The fries were great, the wrap just ok.  We will probably return at some point.

Hn0QahiAjgwxe6iPTbuAdA.text: Had a great experience at the bar! Paulina, the bartender, was on point and took care of all my needs.  For a friendly face and good drinks, I recommend visiting when she's working!

CvOoNDdFvsVtE2KjsObrPQ.text: Lively atmosphere, some food is good, other menu items are bland/stale, etc. Friendly staff but prices are relatively steep. Wouldn't come back, the price to value isn't there for me.  $10 for 7 wings when waitress said there was ~10/lb.

Bx3ErwXkyZgCQ-CiXaVadA.text: I literally ran here after Brass Tap refused to the on the Xfinity race. They already had the race on here and the bartenders were extremely welcoming and friendly. This is how a sports bar is operated . I had a few local beers and a stellar burger. If you would like to watch a televised sporting event in this area , please give this bar your business. Thank you !

Cr-QgwIXR-GNMCDZwPJ_tw.text: Came for a late lunch and sat at the bar, was my first time coming here. Mary was behind the bar and was great, recommended the Piggyback burger and it was amazing. My drink was perfect, even though it was her first time making the sweet caroline, super funny and great service. Thanks Mary!

ZAPY9Q_mwDrZWPIg_Fuofg.text: Mary is the only reason I come here. The TVs are cool. The food is good. The beer is cold. The music is awesome. But Mary is worth the price of admission!!

FaGpqs0gDfqZWSS3_Ko5iQ.text: All American Pub was great! Mary was our server when we went and she was a great waitress and so personable. The Bloody Mary bar was so much fun, I loved getting to make my own drinks. Definitely would come here again on a weekend night!

AjQR7Q3EkpXVMwbIUzyZug.text: We were there on Friday and had to sit on the patio. It was 46 outside and we asked numerous times if they would turn on the heaters.  Servers said they would ask.....20 mins later still no heaters.  I went to ask the hostess if we could get the heater turned on.  Her response......my manager said we could not turn on the heaters they had to save them for TOMORROW.  WHAT?????? We ordered drinks and apps and got them pretty quickly then we ordered dinner.  Thank god we had the apps because we waited 45 mins for 3 hamburgers and some chicken tenders and then got the wrong hamburgers.  In the meantime a table of 8 that came in after us got their food in like 10 mins. We had out of towners with us and this was a poor showing for Southend.

fVdlv7MI8uvFVuh9pWP3xg.text: First I like to say, I love the interior of this place.  The Brick wall, the space, the flat screens.  Location right next to a train stop.  It is nice to say the least. The customer service..not so much.  They are real janky in this area.  For example, is they want to put everything on hold to start a tab even when you're ordering a food item or a drink.  As if paying cash isn't good for them.  Number 2, takes forever for the waitresses to check up on you to see if everything is ok.  So, you want to take our cards but can't check up on us for anything needed.  Yeah, got it.  Not a bad establishment just needs re-tweaking from the customers service end...like a lot of it!  Grade D:

HctKELNCvIVOwLWZ3sTdMg.text: Mary (Miley look alike) was awesome. Very fun and personable. Great service and look forward to coming back soon!

q-YKPnFTo0N6BrR6G17tAA.text: We had Mary as our server this past Monday and she was amazing!! She was someone new but she knew that menu like the back of her hand. So sweet and funny and we really enjoyed our time with her. Definitely ask if she's working if you go! Their food and drinks are amazing and the specials are awesome. Love sitting outside on nice days

ifOwqSJvJTunIsSOhkFeXA.text: Fun place for college/NFL games, but honestly the waitresses are so bizarre. They're either robots or on drugs, but whatever it is it causes an unpleasant experience. Don't come here if you're expecting a great customer service experience, as there is a lot of miscommunication between the workers, as well as with the customers

AQqxuO5yBlSM5LIf2Dla3g.text: Great food, sweet beer. Morgan is the server at the place. Request her if you come, will take great take care.

l42oI0yXriW8119pBzQr8Q.text: Tots were cold and wrap was empty. I was really disappointed by my meal. It's not very good and not worth the price. I don't like eating here and I don't know why I do. Just wanted to enjoy my Saturday with some friends and I got cold tots and a empty wrap!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cold tots

cJH76FiBHGWUuqD-E7Ivaw.text: Hell no. I'm so fed up with this place and it's customer service. I've gave this place so many tries.. and always disappointed. It's so unfortunate because the food is pretty good.   The bald manager is the worst!! So rude and not attentive. The waitress rung my card for the wrong tip; accidents happen, I know which I was completely understanding but wanted to call the manager to let him know. He didn't even care and told me he would couldn't talk at the moment and would call back. Never did. Also, a friend of mine was ordering a meal on the phone to pick up and I just remember him questioning her rudely.   I've made online orders in the past which they seem to never get right !  Or It takes foreverrrr for some of the girls working at the bar to acknowledge someone, especially when you've been waiting 15mins for your pick up order when it was suppose to be done 25 mins prior and ready to be picked up when I first walked in. I don't know how many times I've made a online order that said it would be ready at a certain time and it was never made.

lxdgkEZzVDbP54nj9IQDYQ.text: This place is great for football season. There are a ton of TVs. The menu has pretty good bar food. Decent alcohol selection.   Our server was okay. She seemed a little distracted and didn't pay attention to detail- but otherwise good.

Znr2QSpmwMwrntc1T6W-5A.text: Honestly, my five stars come from the amazing waitress I had named Morgan G. She was so nice, funny and patience (we had people late to the party). I've been to All American many times, the food is great...I love the buffalo chicken wrap and the sweet potato fries. I'm not a hot dog person normally but tried the Chicago (at Morgan's recommendation) and it was remarkable; they are also huge! I would certainly go back and preferably would like to be in Morgan G.'s section again. Hey girl!

CdjtFLip8-pQ2nq5cow6NQ.text: First time here for lunch.  Had the dry rub wings.  Very good.   Also had the water melon capris salad.  This was also good.   Only drawback (and big drawback at that) was the service.  Rarely checked on and sat 15+ min with an empty beer glass on the table. Place wasn't that busy and there appeared to be plenty of servers scurrying around.   You'd think a party of 3 would tip decently but lack of attention to drink refills will always reduce my rating by at least one star.  UPDATE: WOW...Less than 10 minutes after posting this, a manager approached the table and asked if I had a Yelp account.  I replied yes, and he apologized over the lack of better service. He explained the problems the server had with a larger party.   I was very impressed at the quick response and the attention we were given.  Because of this, we will be back!! Great job to management!!!

tDnwFID59BTpjE8Xa6S0gA.text: Average bar food and terrible service. Waitress forgot several drinks multiple times and food sides, yet they were still on the check. Took forever for her to check on us when the place was not busy at all. Food was average. Good place to watch a game but do not go for any other reason.

3l8lN9DvCed3jtqSqxay2g.text: The secret's out....All American has become our "go to" place when it's been a loooong day and we need drinks and a bite after work!  The parking situation can be a bit of a challenge but patience (and some hovering around) will eventually get you in the door. I love the open floor plan and the staff have been pretty consistent with good service.  So Happy Hour is from 4-6pm with half price appetizers and do yourself a favor and get the pretzel with cheese sauce! It comes our warm perfectly crunch on the outside and soft on the inside. It's an excellent start or pair with some beer!  On my last visit I ordered a salad (I know...I know) but it was actually very tasty! I got the Cobb salad with bacon, chicken, avacado, and blue cheese dressing. It was classic. I'd order it again but this place has a pretty fantastic menu! I've seen the burgers, nachos and sandwiches and they all look amazing!   I know we'll be back soon so I can't wait to try out more options!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Cobb Salad

Bu1ybaJ9FlEEXzPs_gsciw.text: Omg the food was amazing ! The temperature was perfect ! The service was fast as hell ! And, the server was very nice !

DBGIUbeIqrB43rOcMN4CXA.text: Worst Chicken Wings ever. I ordered Buffalo chicken wings. Dry and no flavour and hard. This place should be ashamed of serving such wings!!

Vbs-Q7-n3aptj3idvOuAbQ.text: Leaving this place now and will never return. We were at the patio bar and bartender saw us sitting and never approached us to ask us anything. After 10 mins of waiting my husband asked her about service and she said someone from the inside would serve us and continued to help others and not acknowledge us. We went to the inside bar and got drinks and waited for 15 mins and she never returned to get our orders.... needless to say it was horrible experience and we will not return

h6tLKI9eL5sLvzztuIRDxA.text: This is a really fun place for Sunday Funday.  However!!!!! It gets extremely packed.  I mean jam packed and crazy.  We actually managed to find a table, which was a HUGE plus...because if not, I wouldn't have survived.    They have $4 double mimosas on Sunday...yay!  Ask for grenadine to give your mimosa a sweet finish.  The drinks specials are great.  The food is pretty overpriced...but whatever,  I got the cheese sticks and paid $10 for three triangles....but they were tasty.    The staff is nice and does a good job even on crazy Sundays.  I would go back to hang out and watch football for sure.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

xN-ENN0V199F4d86IYdLmg.text: Coldest hot dog and coldest sweet potato fries of my entire life. Don't even get me started on the waitress

cX5BEXuKxUvWsqh2zf0pHw.text: Got some wraps and they were solid enough and the fries were very good and crispy. Fun little patio on a sunny day. Very south-end vibes. Service wasn't great though and that can put a damper on things.

BWCoeQkAidD_JYbtr40lOA.text: We found this place by complete accident.  Thought we were in the Taco joint!  Had a look at the menu and realized we were in the wrong place, but decided to stay.  We went at an off time, so the place was pretty vacant.  They have outside seating overlooking the light rail, so that's nice.  Inside there are TVs everywhere, most with sports.  Not my jam, but I realize it's a pub.  I had the fish sandwich.  The fish was large and perfectly cooked.  Crispy and flaky.  The fun was only toasted on one side, and cold on the other.  I wish they'd have heated the bun.  I had my fries loaded and the cheese sauce was plentiful, and creamy.  I think I'd have preferred melted cheese, but it was still good.    Service was perfect and everyone was very friendly.  It was also clean and the temperature of the restaurant was just fine.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Big Fish with loaded french fries.

0QZEYK_4VzG5-h6au8-tXQ.text: Arrived around 2 to an empty restaurant on a Thursday. The service had to be the worst I've experienced in a long time. The waitress was either new, too daft or just didn't care about the job. Waited over 30 minutes on an appetizer and while we waited to order the meal we saw she was sitting down eating food. I guess we came at her lunch time!? Food took longer than expected and I'm not sure if it was because of the slow service or slow cooks. Won't be back and it's a shame since the reviews in the evening seem to have competent people. Better places to eat In Charlotte and not be treated like an inconvenience. (During the day at least)

hPoKIhyZx_YeB8GS4TuK3w.text: I'm talking drinks and experience only here!  We ended up at All American yesterday to watch my beloved Bills (lose boo) in their first NFL playoff game in 17 years!  Go Bills!  Anyways, Tavern was wayyyy too packed so we ended up here.  We didn't get a table unfortunately, but did have an area where we could stand and had some chairs.  We almost immediately had waitress service and she was awesome.  Our glasses were never empty and she even brought my son crayons and something to draw on!  Love that.  It started getting very packed when we got closer to the start of the Panthers game, which is when we headed out.  Real packed.  $4 Double mimosas?!  Yes please.  And they actually tasted good.  I'll be back, hopefully with a Bills WIN!  :)

aok2uLNXzZIATDCdLIxWBg.text: It's conveniently located right off the Bland Street station of the light rail.  They appear to have good drink specials but overall my Wednesday night dinner there fell short.  The music is so loud you have to yell at the person sitting next to you.  The wait staff wasn't friendly or welcoming. It is probably a great place to catch a game because of all the Tvs but I wouldn't expect much as far as service goes.  I tried the Mac Daddy burger which was very dry even though I had it cooked medium rare.  It was a unique flavor combination with the Mac and cheese and fried jalapenos on top.  They have some unique burgers on the menu but I doubt that I will ever be back to give them a try.

5etFlGRydy6oZ9h21ESeDQ.text: A real staple of Charlotte during Panther season. If you're trying to watch the game then this is the place to be: it's always completely packed with fans. The building itself is awesome, in a really cool area, and easily accessible from the light rail. The coolest thing is that it's connected to 2 or 3 other bars so you can walk from bar to bar without ever having to go outside.   Waitresses have always been really friendly with a special shout-out to Mary who was great today. Menu could use a few more options and is tradition bar food but everything I've had has always been good!   Summary: if you want to catch a Panther game (especially if you're from out of town) you need to catch it here!

k4eUrwjn_uDZ0ks7s0UGUg.text: Our first stop on a leisurely Thursday afternoon for a few beers.  Lets see this place has a lot to offer.  Whether its to watch a game, drink some brew, have some wings, or just chill on the out door patio, or all of the above, its always comfortable and a fun atmosphere.  The service was great and the expected local draft beers did not disappoint.  We enjoyed sitting outside and doing some people watching on the trail that runs through town.  The train passes by every so often but is quite and not very disruptive.  Inside is huge and has a great vibe, a place I wouldn't mind spending more time actually.  Didn't get to try the food but the waitress assured us all of it was very good.  Stop in for a cold one and to watch some sports, you'll be back.

9yAqc9OtLD6UpcI_KVVdhQ.text: Atmosphere: awesome. Open layout great for sports, especially NFL games.   Food: enjoyed the Grilled ham and cheese. Modestly fair portions for price. Was looking forward to sweet potatoes but they ran out, settled for the normal fries   Why the 3 stars? Cleanliness. Granted I ate there after a 1pm Panthers game, the bathroom and table we ate at was slightly disgusting. Will be back again to eat, but not on NFL Panthers game day.

n_5d3mAnrIMzG5yWj55mVQ.text: This place is the epitome of a 3 star joint. Great to come grab a beer and watch sports but if you plan on swinging by for a fulfilling bite to eat, keep walking. Burgers aren't exciting at all and meat just seems like a task to chew through. I feel like this place is only staying alive due to its prime location. Only time will tell.

TNf6cgKv8s1ecFVRnWk2Vg.text: So I was working outside a few doors down from the All American Pub on a Sunday of all days. While working I became a little hungry, and thought I would go to the Pub to get something to eat after looking at their menu online. I saw what I wanted, walked over to the Pub on two separate occasions, and each time I was ignored by the staff. I even stood by the bar trying to get one of the 3 females waitresses attention who were working behind the bar BC only to go orders could be placed there, but they were too busy flirting with the male patrons. I would say that being ignored at an establishment is one of my biggest pet peeves when eating out. Due to their poor service, and their inattention of service, I will not ever be a customer at this establishment for it seems that my worth in this place doesn't mean anything.

Ck2ziHWKvSPun6Qtkr60JQ.text: I just spent the afternoon with Chloe.  I wish she was behind the bar more, because I always have a good time with her!

-ZRaauRLgUY-josE7NLBIA.text: Delicious lunch wonderful friendly staff!! Thank you the buffalo wings are incredible!!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

vgONod22PKXu286ztsgZQw.text: Food was average. Service was terrible. Started off sitting inside and the bartender was barely checking on us. We went outside after awhile and we kept getting forgotten about (server actually kept saying she forgot) There was maybe 20 people in the bar. The bartender spent more time on her phone then helping guests. When asking the hostess if we could get a server outside she didn't even look up from her phone to respond. Staff seems unhappy to be here and it shows in the service.

udOEB8iVxDMh-tpu_cGKIw.text: Let me start by saying Jon Taffer would cream his pants at the ticket Times this establishment continuously destroys. Imagine McDonalds but even faster delivery, or Jimmy Johns if you have an advanced pallet. Secondly, the staff was molded by the Messiah himself as every individual that works here is god sent. Smiles, great banter, and all around human attractiveness is what bleeds out of this place. If I were to die tomorrow and I wasn't cremated, embalmed, or buried at All American Pub then I would haunt all my relatives for destroying my afterlife dreams.  Don't even get me started on the beverages, I feel like I'm drinking the blood of Christ in every Tito's and water that filtrates through my liver. Come to think of it, when Christ comes back he will no doubt enjoy the corn dog nuggets and a Drunken D as his first meal and beverage since his long awaited return at All American Pub. Countrymen, bed wenches and peasant serfs, the day has come where an establishment embodies the desired totalitarian utopia we have yearned for through countless pillaging and imperialism. Sacrifice your lambs, dance in the streets, let us rejoice for All American Pub!  Madison the bartender is a ray of sunshine on a dismal day.

52WdxxeHY_pQLCnMDFKfGg.text: Decent service on game day -- although you should make a reservation or come early -- this place gets crowded! Good deals on mimosas and bloody marys on Sunday and a great set of televisions, so you can just about watch any game you want. Food is fine, nothing to write home about.

Wh--J1UwE9ENwXj99QPBYg.text: This is a pretty typical bar scene. Its definitely a nice environment, its huge and has a lot of seating choices; bar, table, party room etc. which adds to the experience. Another great thing about All American Pub is that they have daily drink specials which are usually a great deal. A few Sundays ago I went and they had 2$ mimosas! So this is definitely something to keep an eye out for!  As far as the food, I wasn't extremely impressed. It was less than I expected, I got a buffalo chicken wrap and I almost couldn't eat it because I kept biting into fatty pieces of chicken. And the portion size was much smaller than I expected as well.  I had been here previously and had a burger which wasn't terrible so if I were to go back I'd probably stick to that again.   If you like football, this is the place to go. During football season every Sunday All-American pub is packed so if you do show up throughout the day you'll be on a wait. But it's usually not too long, about 15-20 minutes and the service is pretty quick for how packed it usually is. It has it's ups and downs, but overall not one of my favorite places.

ENbiRtToGmc6-DKCVhCSIQ.text: Fried pickles were great, hot & crispy. I had the Buffalo crispy chicken sandwich. Huge chicken breast with a lot of fries. All & all with 1 beer & food just under $20.

9EJK06YTCWcAV3l7_r5nbQ.text: Brought a group of 7 to AAP on a Sat afternoon.  Awesome atmosphere, many Tvs, plenty of seating!  The BLT sandwich was incredible, huge beer selection! Will be back for sure!

WlKxeFXTa7SW0jdESdsW0Q.text: I have been to American Pub with the same friend about seven times, five of those seven times have just been terrible experiences yet kept coming back because I would always find an excuse to give them another chance. Whether it be for the delicious french fries and carolina burger or I understand as a fellow server and having worked in customer service since I was 16. I know what it's like to get busy and to have a 40 minutes ticket wait or to have the waitress not tell you when you get sat. However, almost every time my friend and I come in our server takes at least 5 minutes to come greet our table in an empty restaurant (There is a server rule: thirty seconds to get to your table and greet them) and once they got our orders they would check on us about twice before dropping the check. One time we stood at the entrance waiting for someone to greet us or at least tell us to have a seat where ever and they'd have someone to us shortly, without even a passing by bartender saying anything to us we finally left. My same friend and I visited tonight for a quick meal and were surprised to see it almost empty with no more than 30 guests in the restaurant. The hostesses were sweet and inviting and of course had not a problem sitting us, the problems started after we sat down. We sat there for a little over five minutes before a nice red headed girl dressed as a Teenaged mutant ninja approached us and asked if anyone has been with us yet, we said no and she got us waters and let us know our server will be there shortly. Well it wasn't shortly. It took quite a while for her to come and take our appetizer/entree orders. We waited about 30 minutes in a nearly empty restaurant for our appetizer alone. I'm unsure if the Buffalo Shrimp come served cold, if so that's a stupid idea with it being breaded and spicy, if not our shrimp and bottom of the plate were cold. The edge of the plate was warm so it's like it had been sitting under a heat lamp for too long. I'm guessing our server forgot and the cooks didn't let anyone else know to run the food....which is not how it has been done in any restaurant I have worked at. A completed order in the window gets ran with notice to the tables server, that's that. We had them take away the shrimp and our server didn't approach us at all about the situation but once to drop off our burgers. She didn't ask if there was anything she could do, however another server in a leopard jumpsuit did and was extremely apologetic for a mistake that wasn't hers and another girl took away our buffalo shrimp while she walked pass. The GM John came and spoke with us, he handled it well and even paid for our food as we let him know that my friend is a restaurant cook and I am a server so we know how it works and this wasn't working. By that time we no longer wanted to waste time there and left. I have zero excuses now, my tables get snatched if I don't take them within 2 minutes and mine along with my fellow servers asses would be chewed if we just left food in the expo window without asking for a table to go to or the server to run it. It's unacceptable and I wish their service wasn't shitty because I love the food.

qHiVkQ6KOQUMXq-UnoNvEw.text: I have been here numerous times during the week after my Adult League games.  The price for a single pitcher of beer is ridiculous.  My teammates at the table each received lukewarm pint glasses, and 1 received a glass that was spotted and dirty.  While we grabbed the manager he thoroughly looked at the glass in disgust and walked away while mumbling to himself.  Totally rude and unacceptable, however the food tasted great and wasn't too pricy.   Terrible service and pricy drinks, come on over to All American Pub!

XTrvPjhN4ENqTBHneiITcQ.text: Food is ok. Great bar. Love there drink specials. Cant remember which night but they do a 2.50 draft night.

7PYpzo-slMMlhfWHVBdhHg.text: I have really enjoyed coming here in the past, but my last few visits have really turned me off this place.  The service has been completely horrible...I hate doing this, but Taylor is perhaps the worst server I have ever had. She was inattentive and gone for the majority of our time there. When taking orders, she would take 1 at a time and then leave because she couldn't remember more than that. It got to the point where we decided to get up and sit at the bar.  Unfortunately, this wasn't the first time I've experienced bad service there...this time just happened to be the worst. We have been there when it is slow, and the servers were too busy hanging out at the bar rather than waiting tables.   The reason for the 2 stars is because of the service we received at the bar. The girls were both attentive and knowledgeable. If I come back I will make sure I have a seat at the bar!

HfUYsgvrISWV0Inm4Yv1dA.text: good for watching sports but they may have a limited menu during popular games.  parking isnt ideal and it can get pretty clubby once the games are over.

ePv0XbhMr83LSK3YX1k6OA.text: Chicken fingers and Fries were really freaking good! Unfortunately, we also ordered the chicken nachos app and it was not great. I think they use liquid American cheese that kinda reminds me of cheez whiz. And the chicken was not great. I love American cheese, but geez. I can see alot of people liking this though so of course it's just my opinion :) I might come back in the future, but there are so many other pubs I want to try and this didn't really stick out.

tggpKwEw3HwmPVVZRSYHOQ.text: My wife and I went to All American Pub tonight. Despite the generic-sounding name, it was pretty awesome. The interior nice - tons of TVs, some of which I swear were 70"+. It was very clean and spacious - it felt new, but not too new. Food was great - we had the Fried Pepper Jack Sticks (which were honestly the best cheese sticks I have ever had - spicy, seemingly hand-breaded, and with a great marinara for dipping), a Philly Cheesesteak (very good, not great), and the Drunken Fiery Burger (which included beer cheese and deep-fried jalapenos, and my wife absolutely loved). Great draft beer selection including specials tonight on NC drafts for $3.00. The place was very busy - it apparently has already become a neighborhood hangout. An for a good reason - great food, great beer, great atmosphere. Loved it, and it will become a regular spot for us

0EYoTEQHadwrxH5aufqfHg.text: Attended a large holiday event with 100+ people........they were expecting it.  Bar set up in far back, DJ, and Toys for Tots donation table.   Bartendar service was slow at best, they ran out of red wine and told party guests to go up front to the other bar to order it.....but how inconvenient when our tab is at THIS bar?  Hmmm.  left event, not impressed.  However, I am an EVENT PLANNER and i liked the location and space to possibly host one of my own events with 100+ people.  I called 4x without a return call.  Left message each time.  5th call I could hear the person in the background say "tell them I'm busy"......and the person politely said she would relay my name/number.  Never got a return call.  I guess they don't want future business and they just lost a BOAT LOAD of any referral business.   Not good management practices for the poor service during the holiday event and any future business.   Good luck with the college crowd.

r8OpipQnTAX7HquANXzYUg.text: First time at All American Pub. Expected a big crowd as this place is located less than a mile from Panthers Stadium. We arrived fairly early, about 11am. The place is great for sports junkies, there isn't a bad seat in the house if you want to watch sports. We settled on a 2-Top in the bar area. Megan was our server and she did a fantastic job! I went with the triple decker club and curly fries. The sandwich was great- plentiful meats and cheese. The curly fries were hot and well seasoned. The beers were cold and Megan constantly checked in on us.  As the clock ticked closer to 1pm kickoff the place got super busy with a great mix of fans. We were there until halftime, so several hours. We never felt rushed or left unattended. Overall great pregame experience! Will be  Visited again last Sunday (4/21/19) another good visit. Patio seating was nice!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Wedding talks....
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Thanks Quinn!
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

eygt8GmneqJZ-36PtidiJw.text: All American. You don't deserve to have America in your name.  We ordered wine and nachos.  I'll take the blame for the wine. No one should ever order wine at a sports bar, however that's all I wanted and this is where we ended up.   Nachos- nachos topped with cubed chicken, funky "cheese" and chopped tomatoes does not equal nachos. Nachos, a sports bar classic. I can't be at fault for ordering those!   What is the health score here? Could not get that question out of my head.  I don't know what I'm more upset about. Questioning if I'll get sick tonight based on my order, or the great possibility of my husband making me go to this place again once football season starts. If that happens, I'll just do a liquid diet- Truly.

-6kmi5et79WTqMfJ5mV65Q.text: I WANT THOSE CALORIES BACK! Is what we said upon leaving. Ok the thing is: this place LOOKS great for Sunday Funday. I mean I'm sure there's a 50-inch TV in the men's room so that you don't miss a beat of the action. But damn they need to give more of a shit in the kitchen. We ordered nachos on a Wednesday during trivia. They asked beef or chicken, and we went with chicken, thinking it'd be pulled and integrated. Basically what we got is if you under-microwaved tortilla chips and shredded cheddar and then haphazardly threw tomatoes and oversized diced (YES! DICED!) chicken atop. Note to self and all other selves out there: DO NOT GET NACHOS.   But I'll def be back for Sunday football. Hopefully they can't mess up classics like wings or burgers.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Sad Nachos

qybOvi2U6qUq2aiVNLEiTA.text: I was extremely disappointed by my visit here because I heard the wings were great and the pictures looked astounding. A friend and I tried it for the first time, but our wings were cold when they were brought out. I ordered the spicy teriyaki wings which had great flavor. I also ordered spinach and artichoke dip that was ok, but I wouldn't order them again. The dip came with pita chips that I quickly substituted for tortilla chips. During the week from 4-6, they have half off appetizers. I noticed the next day that we were charged full price, so I decided to call to see what happened. Of course no one answered the phone! The only reason they are receiving 2 stars instead of one is because my friend really liked her drink. Unfortunately, my experience here was an overall let down, and I don't think I'll be back.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Spicy teriyaki wings
