yDRy9G-lHcxS3v83DA5wnQ.text: All American is a fun sports bar with yummy food and drinks.  Just beware- this place can get packed for big football game days and can definitely get a little rowdy!  However, if that is your scene, it is a fun place to be!  I love their apps, especially the wings and the "fries, fries, fries:" a delectable assortment of curly fries, sweet potato fries, and seasoned fries. Yum!   They also have good deals on drinks and weekly specials.  I love their Bloody Mary bar during brunch!  Service can be hit or miss, but it is definitely a fun place to come for games!

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Fries fries fries appetizer

EnKibktX_9aDyy0WR1I9fA.text: I ordered the grilled salmon salad that had mixed greens, feta cheese, cucumber, tomatoes & candied walnuts with blue cheese dressing. The salmon wasn't dry & the waitress did not forget my request for an extra side of dressing. The salad was nicely portioned & great. I would order again.   I enjoy All American Pub for their patio during the warmer times of the year for the purposes of the atmosphere & people watching. I went for dinner on a Saturday night, so a DJ was in the i sure playing music. Very pleasant waitress.

UquLKvba5j_14EJzLNEg0w.text: This place was so delicious. My boyfriend and I went here for my birthday. He ordered wings and fries I ordered a chicken wrap and curly fries. We had a great server. She refilled my drink promptly. Would recommend

7zayOHJ6qoipC47eEI-1gw.text: One of the most reliable places to go watch sports they have enough TVs that you can be almost assured you will be able to watch what you want. The food has been inconsistent over the years and I was very sad to see the buffalo chicken dip go as it was my favorite menu item. Still the atmosphere here is great for sports fans especially on college football Saturdays and NFL Sundays. They have a large patio and one of the best mimosa specials in town ($2.00 or $4.00 doubles last I was there!).

irgBe4FcjuYVFYyg1Dh9iA.text: This can be a fun (very crowded) spot to watch Carolina panther games!  They've recently revamped their menu with some cool new things - however, I find the food to be a little stale & lacking flavor.  Their drinks are fun.. they have a sunny D drink that is very yummy!

cVyPNIdypImTjrzL49nqQQ.text: The old manager stares at the girls in such a creepy manner it screams sexual harassment and makes me worried about them. Very uncomfortable to eat here. Food was subpar and drinks are too expensive

c_F33m6RpRF2bf95QGLbVQ.text: Literally so trash lmao overpriced as hell don't waste your time here please. Lousy food lousy drinks lousy service

rfaEHwQ-VjTdQP8DjdFLuw.text: Went to American Pub with a friend and it was really cool. I got a macaroni burger with a drink I don't remember the name but it had tequila and agave in it, it was very delicious! We wend during the Toronto vs Golden State game so It was pretty packed but I'm not sure how crowded it gets on non game days. The music they played was a good mix of old and new school which I liked. Great area for bar hopping as well and the parking wasn't too bad.

ekfxbv83QejCd5wJ8uUUAw.text: This place was very sub par. The wraps and sandwiches were very average and my Mac n cheese was a weird gross separated mess. Noodles with shredded cheese on top would've been better. My roommates favorite food is Caesar wraps and she said hers was the worst she's ever had.

fOlT1U6MhCKtJZzKK8SsjQ.text: fuk this place. My friend & i went here one a weekend night and it was dead, we ordered food it took forever to get out and our order was completely wrong. When i told them it was wrong and didn't want to pay for it the woman pulled the plate out right from me and was incredibly rude. Awful staff and long wait. Don't go here. place sucks.

9uWRrVP1bBTzu9pL3HMASA.text: While visiting Charlotte we visited All American for lunch and to our lucky surprise everything on the menu was half off for the release of their new menu! That meant we got to try a lot more than we would have! I would highly recommend their fried pickles, Mac & cheese, corn pups (mini corn dogs!), triple bang shrimp, & soft pretzels... all were so delicious! We just stuck to appetizers. My one friend has been there numerous times before and was so excited to have the cheesesteak egg rolls- however sadly they were taken off the menu. The waitress recommend steak bites- which were so different and were not that good. They were the only thing that was not finished. It was quiet on that Sunday and the atmosphere was different than I would assume on other days or night, but I loved the sports feel it had all around.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

L0DU9ISvcgiPGSfB8cMOtg.text: Beer is good, burger was bland. Also had an $8 "'merica AF" lemonade that was good but I'm not convinced it's worth $8.  It was also odd to have a bouncer at the door at 5 on a Sunday, that wasn't very friendly.   The menus made me feel dirty after touching them, they were gross.  TL;DR Cool sports bar but not good food.

1qSdNdVzYWqkt-zB4AfmSA.text: The address of this place says a lot...Bland Street.  We went for beer around 4 PM and sat on the patio.  This seems to be a late night "bar" scene, or a dark place to watch a game on the many TVs, but during the day it is depressing.  The "dining room" and patio smelled of stale cigarette smoke (yes, even outside).  The music was loud and was a horrible mix for any time of day - seriously, we bounced non-stop from Kid Rock to Whitney Houston and the like.  There was no one (hostess or otherwise) at the door, and one guy even walked away after no one greeted him, so we had to ask the only bartender where we could sit.  The service was slow.  We were so disappointed that we left after 1/2 a beer and went to a very nearby brewery.   We won't return.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

UHqQOwtetfOR4aES6JD5EA.text: I am a fan of All American Pub. Its a good casual atmosphere and a great place to watch a football game. The service is very inconsistent- sometimes great, sometimes bad. However, the food has always been consistently great. They have good drink specials every day of the week, so make sure to ask about them. Tuesday $5 burger night is a deal. All American Burger with a side of tots. Great salty crispy tater tots. All of the burgers I have had were great. Solid spot.

W-OMrP6rYChkRWhdNTBK5Q.text: Lazy Sunday afternoon, beautiful fall day, perfect to spend some time on a restaurant patio. I drove past the All American Pub, and immediately turned in and parked. They have a great deck area overlooking the light rail tracks and sidewalk.  I went for the burger, and my awesome server Hillary recommended tater tots and a Mimosa ($2 special).   She brought my drink quickly, and when my food arrived, I was overwhelmed!  I don't think I've seen a more appealing burger anywhere!  Charred, cheese dripping off of it, and glorious crispy bacon piled on. Wow!  And it was super tasty!  Big kudos to Hillary  - she kept up with me, made sure I was enjoying my meal, and was always nearby in case I needed something.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Tasty burger!

KkBFf8clD3e67aiIjMuAMQ.text: Who needs Elmer's glue when you have All American nachos.... stuck like glue! If you need school supplies, this bar has you covered.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

cTe01Lt-3uu1sgLukR5TUg.text: Such a disappointment.  Really wish that a pub with a great location and amazing food offered better service.  I enjoy the the neighborhood and fans of collegiate sports; however the service is not on par.  If only they had intelligent and diligent servers, I would enjoy patronizing this comfortable and convieng bar.

JRpbRCLxZjqI5v7F-wV8cA.text: The was nice for a afterword happy hour spot.  On Tuesday Beer Drafts are only $2.50, which was the main selling point for choose this spot as the location.   The Bar is nice and open, which plenty of tvs and seating.    I didn't get any food, but other people at the table did and the Chicken Fingers looked really good.  I'll be trying those the next time

sbazF6-M3hSc1XnUGJtofg.text: Fantastic!!! - the Phillies cheesesteak!!!  Came w/ rib-eye, not at all heavy!!!  In fact, the quantity this restaurant serves is just right - doesn't overwhelm you. It seems to put quality over quantity. The servers were great as well

tGk2BhNBb8HEPFHHAAvmJQ.text: Service was a little slow today but the food was good. Husband really enjoyed the appetizer selections. Great place to stop for a bite and beer off the tracks.

usbzbr-k2O5S5i3JW4kaFg.text: Food here is not very great... The chicken tastes like the processed frozen chicken you can get from the supermarket.   But this is the best place in Charlotte for NFL games! Get there early so you can get a table. And the bloody Mary bar is awesome!

IWlrSU_RO0rq3AuEIr-pgA.text: Man, I wish this place had or would use TabbedOutCharlotte.com Everytime i come here to get my favorite Tryon Turkey sandwich, i hav to keep pullin out my credit card for them to open tab. Then when im ready to leave i hav to wait to close because its crowded. #TabbedOutCharlotte all day. I'll tip these beautiful women all day using my TabbedOut app.

C1KoDY8KuZoyM-cd5Q9Q3Q.text: This place has a great atmosphere, but, unfortunately, that is about all it has. First off, our waitress took our drink orders then never came back to take our food order. We had to ask another waitress to get ours for us. Then we waited close to 45 minutes for our food. When it did come my chicken in the chicken Caesar salad was severely over-cooked. The same goes for my date's breakfast burger. He ordered it medium-rare and instead got a well done burger with no pink showing. I also spilled my drink and the waitress never noticed. Despite the new look and new menu, this place still disappoints.

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States. Meh...

21qa6Lyarvgc8271Xn9wJQ.text: I only wish the food was as good as the service. The host and waitress where extremely friendly and very helpful and very well-trained. The food on the other hand was a completely different story. My wife ordered a fish and chips, which tasted more like pork rinds then fish. It was clearly a frozen piece of fish thrown into the deep fryer, so we pretty much paid $13 for french fries. I ordered a prime rib, considering it was Wednesday and that was their special. I ordered it medium. When I was served my meal, it was a thin piece of prime rib that was overcooked. It was good, but it any lacked flavor or spices. I also opted to upgrade from the broccoli to the spinach. My spinach was nothing more then steamed spinach with no seasoning, no bacon, no garlic, nothing! it was completely bland and gross. All said and done, it was not worth the $18 that they charge for it. I don't think I will ever eat an entree at this place again.  I might go back and try a burger or a sandwich, maybe they're better at that. This place is clearly not the place to eat entrees, The food was very disappointing.

Qw7r0Z1tYGBvZPMbO3hpgg.text: I've been here plenty of times. I go with my kickball team because they sponsor them so I end up going here every week. The hostess is usually very friendly and so are the servers but they are extremely slow. It always seems to take us forever to get any food. We get pitchers of beer, and a lot of the time it will be flat or just taste terrible. They always say it's because the leg is out and they need to change it but for that to happen at least 3 times to us seems a little bit fishy. They do have a ton of tvs so it's great for games but it gets so packed in there during any big game that you never can get a seat. The food is pretty good. If only they could get better servers and get their food out faster and their beer figured out it would be a great spot.

7Ih_Jg8V-eiETIZlpymbxg.text: I don't like writing a bad review - I really want to like this place as I'm a huge fan of sports bars, craft beers, their live music on Wednesdays, and the location. However, the service at All American Pub is horrible! One of my first experiences was the bartender poured my draft beer, and before handing it to me, wiped the glass with a dirty bar towel. Oh heck NO! The next time I went there, our drinks kept running dry and there was no site of our waitress. Then my friend got his food, and it was not what he ordered. This past visit, we attended an event, and when we tried to join our friends at the table, the staff said we couldn't sit there. What?!?!?!  We had to literally persuade the staff  to let us sit with our friends and order drinks and food! It's the craziest thing! Please management, if you're reading this, schedule a staff meeting and address the service!

Rh5AR7OyMhHucRYDPB_Jww.text: I was pleasantly surprised to find this place as my friend and I took a ride on the light rail for the heck of it and jumped off the Bland Street station for some grub and good times.  For the guys, all the waitresses were pretty fine.  For everyone, the food was really good.  Maybe it was because I was a little tipsy, but the fish sandwich here was da bomb-diggity.  I even complimented to the waitress how awesome indeed that sandwich was.  The food came out fresh and hot and I don't really have any complaints about this place for a first time visit.  Food was stellar, our glasses stayed full and people were relatively friendly that worked there.  Definitely up there for a random place we picked out.  Check em out if you are in South End.  I think they are worth it.

SIhrIB_CDB8CpLtDY4krfA.text: All american pub is a great spot.  The bar is a decent size with some outside seating where you basically stare at the light rail :).  There is a decent selection of beer and the service is fast.  All American is a great spot for football and a better option than tavern on the tracks or gin mlll if you are in this area.  What suprised me the most was the food.  I thought it was going to be so so, but the food was actually very good and the price point wasn't high at all. For now this is my Sunday football spot.

7uDbFv3FiPVvdQWCZ7yLyQ.text: I went to the Wells Fargo Championship this week and decided to try this spot inside the venue.  It was terrible.  I had the Meth burger.  All the food was cold, the price was bad and the wait was ridiculous.  I will not be returning at the club or any of their locations. I would give this a 0 but they do not allow it.

jtWC1jcb5OHCWGyaYeoc7Q.text: This place is like a massive Braswells and a must spot for watching sporting events. Staff was very nice and attentive, tons of big TV's, lots of beer choices and the food was surprisingly delicious. I had the salmon salad and didn't expect much but it was fantastic. The wings were delicious (Teriyaki sesame) and the shrimp and fries were good too.  For the right group of people this is a nice place.  Good solid place to visit.

REy3xyFHq__jr3ggy3ZZzA.text: Went here to have a few drinks and watch a UNC game.  We already had dinner so just wanted to meet up with some friends. We sat at a 4 top table waiting until a 10 top was open. We waited at least 30 minutes before our waitress took our drink orders. Being the patient people we are, we did wait since friends were on our way. We asked about drink specials and the waitress seemed so confused. 15 minutes later our drinks arrived. Our friends did as well. They went to the bar to order drinks since we had warned them about the server. The 10 top was now available so we did switch over to that and a different waitress. We recieved much better service after that.

l3OxCKjmQ0hi0lckHh7Ujg.text: Good atmosphere and great selection of beer and drinks.  I had a business lunch here and it was very tasty.  Ordered a buffalo chicken wrap and it didn't disappoint.  Our server was attentive and we were in and out in less than an hour!  Perfect for a great lunch!

Cm_0EGLuOF4hYS0kxqb-0g.text: We stopped in for a new place to try a late lunch.  It was pretty quiet when we arrived, and were quickly seated and waited on.  The menu wasn't overly extensive, but had a good selection of burgers, chicken and other sandwiches, and a few salads.  I ordered the pulled pork BBQ, but they brought me the cheesesteak in error.  I was surprised by this as there were very few diners in the room.  When I saw how it was prepared, it looked pretty tasty, choppy and filling, I kept it to try.  I was glad I did as it was pretty delicious, and the grain bun was fresh, too.  The fries were good, slightly crispy, with a pickle on the side.  I thought overall it was quite underwhelming and unimpressive for the size and decor of the restaurant.  Nothing fancy about the food, especially for the price.  It wouldn't be my first choice to go to again for a meal.

hptvAkzSJ2_FXz2ixUbVQg.text: Great location off light rail.  Decent food and ALWAYS a beer special.  Great TVs for game day too.

eOZfOLe9QxVEcSdSWkny5w.text: This place reminds you of a college bar. So, you have that expectation going in, then everything is kosher. Most people in here are usually in their 20s and repping their sports teams. It's a great atmosphere, and the food is ordinary bar food. Although, the wings are pretty good. Game days are fun here. The crowd is fratty but good looking.

DV40zRtUQv1rF3TSennhzQ.text: Good place to watch a game, the bartenders were fairly attentive but food service time was poor. After 30+ minutes waiting for an app, I canceled the order and asked for my check.

-EPQ5Ug2p3EjfmGmfRTUwQ.text: Stopped in here for lunch one day.  This place is owned by the same people as Brazwell's and Joe Hooper's which are also on my bookmarked list.  The layout of the bar/restaurant hasn't changed much since the old Jillian's which used to be in this space.  There's a few additions to note the name of the pub.    I initially sat at the bar but being a tall person, I realized the bar seating is a bit uncomfortable for a tall person and moved to one of the nearby 2-seater pub tables.    The beer menu consists of craft, domestic and import beers.  There are NC beers represented here but the only Charlotte beers are from OMB.    The food menu includes all the pub standards,...burgers, apps, sandwiches, salads and a few other things.  According to the staff, the burgers are supposed to be good here but I opted for a Black and Blue chicken wrap with fries and a pickle spear.  The food came out quickly and the wrap was quite tasty.  The fries were a bit disappointing and I had to smother them with watered down ketchup to make them more appealing.    I was served mostly by the bartender unless she was busy and then someone else helped her.    Overall a decent place to have a beer or a bite after work or before a game.

VoQdLMYVvvP1mby0S_aJLw.text: We stopped in here one evening before a Bobcats game (when they were winning), and it was good.  It was a Monday at around 5 o'clock, so it was not too busy.  For those who have been in the QC for a while, AAP operates in a small portion in the now defunct Jillian's space next to Greek Isles.  Our waitress was very nice and friendly. We got half priced wings for happy hour and they were good, especially for the price.  They had OMB Copper on special, so that was nice too.    There isn't too much else to review.  This place is along the lines of most American sports pubs, but definitely a step above some of them.

TPpRsTZUeinefALXGdEzVg.text: When all you need is a delicious, greasy meal to smother your hangover.... Don't go to eat at all American pub. Everything on the menu screams mediocrity.   I had the buffalo chicken wrap and it was ok. A decent amount of food, sure-but not much flavor. The fries were flavorless too. My friends who ordered the philly cheese steak and cheeseburger could on use one word to describe their food quality as well:mediocre.  The service was slow and the food ok. I'll go back to watch football and drink (tons of awesome TVs, but will probably never eat again there.

X1Jd9OHMkDpaEHUdChqkMA.text: I like this place. Went on a Sunday to watch the football games. Great crowd of people. Food was ok; typical "bar" food and drinks were good and not too pricey.  It does get crowded and seating can become a problem so if you're going for a particular event, get there on time or early if you want to sit. They play great music and good overall atmosphere.

jtLI0zYvqTVeTAfbma8oMQ.text: My amigo and I decided to check out All American Pub (AAP) before heading uptown to the epicenter for AA8.  On this particular Thursday evening, they had a promotion going on that included beer and wings.   The beer was straight - bud lite and miller lite draft from a piTCHer - no complaints here.   The wings were surprisingly good for a new establishment.  The sauce, a simple HOT sauce, was tasty, but it was the sweet, not the heat that made this sauce.  I def recommend the wings if you are looking for something to try.  I am anxious to return to sample other items on the menu.  The service was excellent.  Not only was the wait staff easy on the eyes, but they were friendly, professional and quick to refill anyone that needed beer or water.    The interior is cool.  I like that they have plenty of screens hanging throughout the bar.  I also like that they have a long bar, with plenty of seating.   Overall, I must say AAP has peaked my interest.  So far they are off to a good start with a solid mix of food, service & ambiance.  This is a place I would def like to try again, and a place I might consider when looking for a sports bar in the area.

88ve1762EHpo2F-KgBMFAw.text: This place is just wayyyy too packed. Went to watch football one evening, and it had to be 50 people over its max capacity. With it being so busy it was nearly impossible to get a drink at the bar. I won't go back, not on the weekend anyway.

H2p1_zwZ0R43uoTpU-tlJw.text: Excellent grilled chicken salad with great additions and dressing. All American Pub is located close to uptown and is a perfect venue to watch a game. Our server, Lexi, was very attentive and friendly!  We'll be back

5cxxYB-NyKtfxaGk20Z2Ig.text: This place is amazing! The staffing is awesome! My first visit was ......... Terrific! Very clean.... Friendly bathroom host... The manager name is Chad.... He has a over the top personality... Because of him i recommend this place to everyone.... The food was delicious! I will be returning... Also Morgan was friendly.... And pretty.... So roll down to All American Pub.... You will not regret it

5dK04TO2ivJeq8Y4-XtxXA.text: Had decent service while having drinks. Although they were minimum in quantity  the drinks were great. However because the drinks were few and we were taking take le space, the manager, Chad asked us to leave. We did find Chad's request unusual for a Tuesday we obliged. The service was treat the management, Chad was awful

Ytz0XQDaa1-VBmtX9Q77nw.text: Really liked the feel of this place. They have a nice, open space and a nice diversity of sitting locations. I haven't eaten the food, but the beer selection was good. The prices were a bit high, but nothing out of the ordinary for the uptown area.  My friend had his wedding reception in one of the back rooms and, although I couldn't attend, I know they had a great time.  I'd go back again.

HhwewbEnXHykLxs-RvcHXA.text: Ahhh All American Pub, my go to when there are sports I want to watch and hangout with friends.  This is our go-to spot and we are always treated very well.   TVs everywhere that allow you to catch action all over the restaurant.  Perfect for sports fans.   They have their own parking lot which makes it great to not have to pay.  They also use their lot for special events and it's definitely large enough to hold those.   Drink and food prices are not the bad.  I love the pretzel with cheese, get it every time I'm there.  The chicken nachos are also delicious.   Tim the GM is the nicest guy.  Always accommodating and friendly with everyone.    Since this place is packed during football season be prepared for waits at the bar but that's what happens when you go to "the" spot before/after the games.

bWc47mck5mlvZs99LXxOLA.text: Came here during U.S. Vs Ghana and this place was packed to say the least. Shoulder to shoulder, no open seats... A great environment to be in for the win. For any sporting event, after work drinks, or late night debauchary, this place is perfect. Yes, the crowd is definitely younger and rowdy.     Yes, getting a drink was a slow process but the bartenders handled it very well. I had the audacity to order food and after waiting for a bit a manager went out of her way to approach me and singlehandedly search for it. She went above and out of her way, stopped what she was doing to help me out.  After her efforts, the food wasn't that great or anything special. This is a sports bar for crying out loud, not a fine dining establishment, but the fact she went out of her way speaks volumes.

UmJufy_zHsYKZCekBMDu0Q.text: Go to spot for sports watching, lots of TVs everywhere.  I came here to watch all the USA world cup games and the NCAA basketball tournament.    This bar has a typical bar food menu but I really enjoy everything I have had on it.  The service is average and gets slower during big games and when the place is crowded.  They have a nice patio with outdoor seating as well and TVs outside!

hzWyYjnPUKQJHoE5UD15CQ.text: So...apparently they serve a limited menu on Sunday.  Ok..I get that. But how about keeping the 2 things you have available for vegetarians in Stock??? My first...and LAST time here. I mean seriously?  I got to watch my friends eat...lovely. And don't bother talking to the manager. He could care less...didn't catch name. ...bald guy. I'm suppose to believe they ran out "last night"...uh.huh....whatever.

xKslb9TUNz3AhDSLCMe0-Q.text: The food was great and the service was AMAZING! I had the best server named Hillary, she was friendly, attentive, funny and so sweet! I would come back just cause of her excellent service and professionalism!

J9IzJkTRSNHjlKuPD-RbHA.text: Not bad food for being so corporate. I do have to say, they're pretty stingy with their napkins.

GrE5QQ8NxA9VIAxb_u3fkQ.text: I don't eat here often, I typically just drink. The food was okay, but it wasn't even crowded and it took forever to get our check. She was nice but our check was wrong and she didn't split the check correctly. She was new, so I'll be back to try the food again.

FTbEGvudsNdc5FaA-rvUGg.text: I come here all the time, admittedly because my building is directly next to it. The food is much better than you would expect from this type of bar (while maybe slightly overpriced) and service is usually really good. In fact, the busier it gets the better the service! Really fun, chill atmosphere. I have been going here at least once a week for over a year and have never had a complaint.  Today I made a to-go order for the first time because I was craving All American's sweet potato fries (they are incredible) and they told me my order would be ready in 10 minutes. They took a longer than ten minutes, and didn't charge for the order because of the delay.  I didn't think I could ever love this place more than I already did!

qBxpzziU1KCDeK3L2PP10g.text: All American is a great location for semi decent food with plenty of TVs to watch any game or fight of your choosing. Staff are attentive and friendly. The noise level can sometimes be a challenge if you are trying to have a conversation and if you plan on visiting for a panther game, be prepared for your table to be intruded upon due to limited space.

q3Xt07WQCjrsUzrwc-cUdQ.text: Great place to go out and have drinks with friends ! Happy hour is also awesome from 4-6 half off apps ! Staff is really friendly ! Should definitely check it out!

WIEdkvArqE5rKbKZ2Eh0oA.text: I had such high hopes.  Place looks cool with the brew vats and old building, but the actual restaurant fell far short.  Wanted a flight at the bar, you can only get the beers they offer that day in a flight.  First time for that. Not cool.  Then there was the food.  Ordered the BBQ, cause that's what the waitress said was best.  It came out and had no taste at all.  Didn't eat hardly any of it and waitress never even asked if I like it. So I order more sauce to try to eat it.  That didn't help either and they charged me $.25 for a tiny container of sauce on a $13.00 BBQ plate.   Wth?  Buddy just got wings and even they were cold.     I told the waitress about not liking it (which I never ever do) and they credited me $6.50 off out total bill.  If they had not changed me the $.25 for the extra sauce, I would have never said a word.

we51hjkdKtFLGvf5DKwhgQ.text: The frozen fries ( still stuck together ) I don't care for. Cut your own potatoes and make some real fries!  The steak and cheese was lacking seasoning and flavor!  You can do better/first time in today.

B4OML2DBRpmTNHPFANY9Bw.text: Had a great first experience at All American Pub tonight all because of my server, Hayliegh!Hayleigh service was amazing, she was extremely fast getting our drinks and food to the table. If you are looking for great service, great bar food, and trivia on a Wednesday night definitely check out AAP.

x_3ZaF_X6r5hyLpDUnHJDA.text: Hayleigh was great, very attentive and informative about specials! She made girls night for us extra fun. Thanks again, H!

8cmRWGmO_t6PzliVJ-ZN4g.text: Went here today for lunch for the first time. I got a burger with Mac and cheese on it and it was delicious! We ordered loaded fries which came with good queso, jalapenos, chives, and bacon. My boyfriend got the Philly cheesesteak sandwich which he said was dry and okay. We will be back!

AUoazn58iTWULvU7LN_RwA.text: The place to be on game days.   This place is always packed on Sundays, but it is a pretty cool environment. Get there early if you want a table.. like 11:00am. They have $2 mimosas on Sundays and other great drink specials throughout the week. Chicken tenders are pretty good. If you want craft beer, go to a brewery. Also, half off apps m-f from 4-6!

RPd5Jvoz7EfhX7vm08SDcg.text: One of the best places to watch Panthers games!!! They have a Bloody Mary bar with all the bells and whistles too!

4uGUveh7Vr9RODYu7E2rIg.text: Had an awful experience at All American Pub tonight. The drinks took forever, the food came out incorrectly, the checks had things on them that they shouldn't. We asked to speak to a manager and he was appreciative of our feedback but didn't feel compelled to do ANYTHING about our terrible experience. Will not be back. I ordered a stella and it came out no where near full. I work in the restaurant industry and know how things should be and everything about this restaurant missed the mark.

q8122AfsxbqvyzbhE-RAYw.text: The only reason I'm giving this 3 starts is because of the dude that saved the day. So I came here last Friday with my man and he's just talking about how this place has pretty good burgers and it's good during lunch... well I guess that I may be the case, but for dinner... I thinks not.   First we get seated immediately and wait 10 minutes before I had to get up and stopped the manager walking by to let him know that no one has come to our table. Then a brown-skinned dude tatted up was friendly enough to say he'll take care of us as I told him no one has brought our drinks after another 10 minutes. We get our order (mind you, we know what we want as soon as she comes to take our drink order, because she took so long) and then it's crap. Now.... I know a pub will more than likely be known for it's good beer... maybe some appetizers; but they could at least get a burger right. I wasn't even asked how I wanted it (I like mine medium btw). So this burger is mad dry. I mean dusty dry, no juice, no pink, no motivation to eat this thing.   Yea... 3 stars for the dude comping our order... we only paid for one meal. Huuuu... such a disappointment though.

kfHtzvMfW6LsFjSwLt6rBA.text: I definitely like this place.  It can get very busy on the weekends and when the games are on but it is a really fun environment to be in.  Its a pub atmosphere so its very casual and chill.  Food isn't too bad either - Drinks are typical pub drinks.

uQZH14k-z4hoHEibuOGjaw.text: Mediocre service, but gets a passing grade because the bar itself is pretty sweet.     They have a bunch of TVs all over the place and plenty of seating indoors and outdoors.  Service at the bar is a bit lackadaisical on slower days... but that doesn't mean I don't want my beer any slower!  Haven't tried the food, but heard that it's decent.   I'm not good at reviewing bars.  Gimme beers, sports, and women--I can't complain much.    dmo out.

Pe1n5gqKPc0_3SGDfghXSw.text: I'd give it a 4.5 if they allowed half stars.   All American Pub is just what the name says. It gets a great clientele of mid 20's to early 40's after work type crowd.   This place is awesome for just about any time . . .   - They have a ton of huge TVs which are great for watching any sport  - They have a huge patio which is going to be great as the warmer months are coming.   The wait staff is great, the food is good. The mac and cheese is decent and I only say that cause it's 'sister bar" Whiskey Warehouse has amazing mac and cheese. Not sure why they don't use the same recipe. Or maybe they do and I just had it on an off day. They also have really good sweet potato fries. One of the best I've had in Charlotte. Pair that with some pure honey for dipping and you've got a great side dish.

vHMskDE99Q5bA785nAfKsQ.text: Came here last night to watch the Panthers game. We arrived 30 minutes before kickoff and, as expected, it was packed!!! We had no chance of getting a table and the hostess said one wouldn't be available until after the game. (So, just note, that if you want a table here for a big game, come super early!!). We headed to the bar and were content with standing and watching with everyone else in the bar area. They have a good amount of beers on tap and Thursdays is $3 NC beer night. Yay for Shotgun Betty!   Didn't eat food on this specific occasion but we have eaten here many times and the food is pretty decent bar food. Will update this review with specific food items next time we go.

L543LsF6FNGTJt6tqHsuKg.text: Came here during a panthers game with a group of friends. The waitress was very concerned our tabs wouldn't be accounted for since we were all moving around throughout the bar, but we assured her everything would be paid. At the end of the night, myself and 3 friends asked to close out. We had to guess how many drinks we had, she charged us (after a VERY long waiting period) and we left. Then, about an hour later, we got a call from our remaining friend at the bar. He had been charged EVERYTHING. She forgot all of our food and a few of our drinks and stuck him with the items she forgot to add to our tabs. He was left with $160 to be accountable for. Of course we paid him back and got everything figured out, but it should have never ever been an issue. Our tabs should have been correct the first time as to avoid sticking our friend with a massive bill at the end. It was the waitress' mistake and there was absolutely no ownership on her part. Unprofessional, frustrating and absurdly inappropriate.   EDIT 11/4:  I'm going to amend this review from 1 star to 3. The most recent time I was at All American the waitress came up and apologized. I understand accidents happens and everyone is entitled to a bad day every now and then. Especially on busy game days!

JiYsnluPf_Is-Fk_qHg6kQ.text: Came here to meet up with some friends for the Dook/UNC game. It was packed and luckily we had spots saved for us.   For the amount of folks in there, I will say that the service was great. She visited often and kept up with everyone's orders.   I did not eat this go round, but everyone else's plates looked like it was decent.

9fgHPnOpTidsoUrddMTnGA.text: This is a huge open restaurant that would be perfect to go to for a game with tons of tabs around. They have happy hour specials and for Monday night football half off wings! I was skeptical about wings as I always am, being from buffalo. However, they weren't bad. They were surprisingly ok. I got the spicy BBQ and they were just spicy enough for me. The atmosphere was very friendly, people outside had their dogs on the patio so they allow that for all the dog lovers! I'd def come back to watch a game. Service was great as well! Drinks and food came out quick!

avLruLcPPGHYnOCFc28hfQ.text: Got lunch today at this place.  It was literally the worst lunch I've had in years.  I got the chicken Caesar salad (not sure how you mess that up).  The dressing tasted like watered down mayonnaise minus the taste of mayonnaise.  The chicken had as much flavor as the mayonnaise dressing.  Ordered anchovies on the side.  Got anchovies that weren't traditional anchovies used in a Caesar salad.  They were just plain anchovies packaged in water.  Either this place buys extremely cheap ingredients or the kitchen manager has no idea how to cook.  If you like beer and good looking women servers, this place is good.  But, the food is sub sub par.  Not my first time eating here.  That's why I ordered the Caesar.  I figured they couldn't screw that up.  I guess I was wrong again.  Won't be back.

f1qhN3Mv51vS155d6DaZ_g.text: Excellent bar in southend. If you enjoy sports and beer this is the place to be.   **Sit in the bar area

photos.caption: Photo of All American Pub - Charlotte, NC, United States

bXVzOxdWgjDL_eaPo6AkkA.text: Is is not a food review since we did not get a chance to dine today but I want to give recognition to our server who worked her buns off.  She took very good care of over 30+ ppl at the Seminoles table.  Thanks for your hard work.

DHIIfqtbYw-qXg5RvdhfeA.text: If you want to go someplace with some friends to enjoy a game with decent food and good selection of beer this place is it.  Somehow it just has the right feel for a sports bar.  Doesn't feel so corporate like Buffalo wild wings.    Wings are pretty good and the other food items are ok as well.  Better then average for a sports bar,  Wait staff is friendly though they can get very busy during local games and are not as chatty as when it is a little slower.  It is our goto place to watch games with friends.
